item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

[quote=“zachrida, post:5, topic:367303”][quote author=usman555 link=topic=463406.msg3400207#msg3400207 date=1289853308]

you should make it more newb friendly, like adding how to declare methods and such!
[/quote]Are you a fail? I can’t even repond to that how it’s so fucking spoonfeeding. If you can’t even declare a method, then fuck off from MoparScape and learn java.

you sir can fuck off.[/quote]It’s not a tutorial like this

First get an apple, from the grocery store. Then give it to the cashier. Give the cashier 10 cents. The cashier will let you keep the apple. Then go home. When you're home, eat the apple, how? Well open your mouth, put the apple in front of you'r mouth and bite. How do you bite? Slowly descend your teeth forward to the apple. This will cut the apple. Then swallow the apple by gulping it.
Instead, I'd do this
Buy an apple from the grocery store for 10 cents. Then go home and eat it.
You expect me to do example one. It's not tutorial-like. If you actually need that much information, well, then [i]you[/i] are the one that needs to fuck off.

item.title: [317][Delta][!MUST-SEE!] ~~~ Axe Killer ~~~ [!MUST-SEE!][Delta][317]
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

[anchor=top][iurl=#bottom]Go to bottom[/iurl]

What you are adding: You are adding a custom minigame, Axe Killer.
Difficulty: 3/10
Knowledge req: Understand codes, copy (ctrl + c) and paste (ctrl + v)
Purpose: To add an amazing minigame called Axe Killer a basic NPC killing minigame
Credits: 100% Credits to Usman555[anchor=contents]
[hr]

[center][size=20pt]Table of Contents[/size]

[hr]

[size=15pt][iurl=#onek][1000] - What is Axe Killer?[/iurl]
[iurl=#twok][2000] - How would I add it?[/iurl]
[iurl=#twopointone][2100] - Declaring methods, ints, booleans[/iurl]
[iurl=#twopointtwo][2200] - Character Tokens[/iurl]
[iurl=#twopointthree][2300] - Making Rewards Work[/iurl]
[iurl=#twopointfour][2400] - NPCHandler, PlayerHandler, textHandler and clickingmost[/iurl]
[iurl=#twopointfive][2500] - Making Chests Work[/iurl]
[iurl=#glossary][Glossary] - Glossary[/iurl][/size]

[/center][hr]

[anchor=onek] [center][size=15pt][b][1000] = What is Axe Killer?[/b][/size][/center]

[anchor=hi]Axe Killer is a very fun minigame that your players would LOVE to play. It is a basic minigame in which the players are required to kill axes and recieve in
axe points. These axe points will be used to claim rewards. The rewards can include anything of your choice when you edit them (see part 2300). In this base tutorial, you will recieve a rewards list. Something that will look like this

20 Axe points = 10M Gp
50 Axe points = 30M Gp
100 Axe points = Full 3rd Age Mage
150 Axe points = 100M Gp
300 Axe points = Fighter torso
500 Axe points = Sled
700 Axe points = Santa Hat
800 Axe points = Bow-Sword
1000 Axe points = 1B Gp
2000 Axe points = Godsword Hilt Set

Remember that in this tutorial, you won’t buy the items, but the system will automatically generate the items in the player’s inventory.
[iurl=#contents]Go to Table of Contents[/iurl]

[anchor=twok] [center][size=15pt][b][2000] = How would I add it?[/b][/size][/center]
[anchor=twopointone] [center][size=12pt][b][2100] = Declaring methods, ints, booleans[/b][/size][/center]

Declare the following in client.java

public void AxeRewardScreen() { // declaring a method called AxeRewardScreen sendQuest("@dre@Axe Killer Rewards", 8144); // set title to axe killer rewards clearQuestInterface(); sendQuest("", 8146); // change these rewards if necessary sendQuest("20 Axes Killed = 10M ", 8147); sendQuest("50 Axes Killed = 30M", 8148); sendQuest("100 Axes Killed = Full 3rd Age Mage", 8149); sendQuest("150 Axes Killed = 100M", 8150); sendQuest("300 Axes Killed = Fighter Torso", 8151); sendQuest("500 Axes Killed = Sled", 8152); sendQuest("700 Axes Killed = Santa Hat", 8153); sendQuest("800 Axes Killed = Bow-Sword", 8154); sendQuest("1000 Axes Killed = 1B", 8155); sendQuest("2000 Axes Killed = Godsword Hilt Set", 8156); sendQuest("", 8158); sendQuestSomething(8143); showInterface(8134); flushOutStream(); } // ending method

public void AxePanel1() { // declaring a method called AxePanel1 setInterfaceWalkable(15892); sendQuest("", 15894); sendQuest("Axe Killer", 15895); // title of panel sendQuest("Axe Points: "+AxeKilled, 15897); // telling the player how many points (s)he has sendQuest("", 15898); sendQuest("", 15899); sendQuest("", 15900); sendQuest("", 15901); sendQuest("", 15896); sendQuest("", 15902); sendQuest("", 15903); sendQuest("", 15904); sendQuest("", 15905); sendQuest("", 15906); } // ending method

public int AxeScore = 0; // declaring an int called AxeScore and setting it's value to 0 public int AxeKilled = 0; // declaring an int called AxeKilled and setting it's value to 0

public boolean isInAxeKilla() { // declaring a boolean called isInAxeKilla if ((absX >= 3407 && absX <= 3418 && absY >= 3483 && absY <= 3494)) // checking coords return true; // if player is in the coords above, set boolean's value to true else // checking two return statements (true or false) return false; // if player is not in the coords above, set boolean's value to false } // ending boolean
[iurl=#contents]Go to Table of Contents[/iurl]

[anchor=twopointtwo] [center][size=12pt][b][2200] = Character Tokens[/b][/size][/center]

Add these tokens in client.java

} else if (token.equals("character-AxeScore")) { // self explanatory AxeScore = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-AxeKilled")) { AxeKilled = Integer.parseInt(token2);
Now add these two.

characterfile.newLine(); // you don't need to know what this shit means. characterfile.write("character-AxeScore = ", 0, 21); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(AxeScore), 0, Integer .toString(AxeScore).length()); characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("character-AxeKilled = ", 0, 21); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(AxeKilled), 0, Integer .toString(AxeKilled).length());
[iurl=#contents]Go to Table of Contents[/iurl]

[anchor=twopointthree] [center][size=12pt][b][2300] = Making Rewards Work[/b][/size][/center]

Add this underneath boolean process (client.java)
Before I give you it, many ask why I made you declare “AxeScore”. Well it’s to prevent people from getting the same reward again and again. You see later on, we will make chests in the area that reset your score. So if you want to get the same reward again, you would reset your current score and do it again. This is why we use the AxeScore integer to keep count to prevent people from getting the same reward again and again.

if(isInAxeKilla()) { // if the person is in axekilla (check the boolean in step 1) AxePanel1(); // call out the axe panel method if(AxeKilled == 20 || AxeKilled == 21 || AxeKilled == 22 || AxeKilled == 23) { // if the person has the following scores... if(AxeScore == 0) { // and the person's score is zero... addItem(995, 10000000); // add 10M sM("You have just won 10M for 20 axes Killed!"); // send a message AxeScore = 1; // set the score to one. } } else if(AxeKilled == 50 || AxeKilled == 51 || AxeKilled == 52 || AxeKilled == 53) { // if the person has the following scores... if(AxeScore == 1) { // and the person's score is one... addItem(995, 30000000); // add 30M sM("You have just won 30M for 50 axes Killed!"); // send a message AxeScore = 2; // set the score to two } } else if(AxeKilled == 100 || AxeKilled == 101 || AxeKilled == 102 || AxeKilled == 103) { // if the person has the following scores.... if(AxeScore == 2) { // and the person's score is two... addItem(660, 1); // add all of this 3rd age mage crap addItem(650, 1); addItem(640, 1); sM("You have just won full 3rd age mage for 100 axes Killed!"); // send a message AxeScore = 3; // set the score to three } } else if(AxeKilled == 150 || AxeKilled == 151 || AxeKilled == 152 || AxeKilled == 153) { // if the person has the following scores... if(AxeScore == 3) { // and the person's score is three... addItem(995, 100000000); // add 100M sM("You have just won 100M for 150 axes Killed!"); // send a message AxeScore = 4; // set the score to four } // continue with all the rest of the rewards. And more if you wish. } else if(AxeKilled == 300 || AxeKilled == 301 || AxeKilled == 302 || AxeKilled == 303) { if(AxeScore == 4) { addItem(430, 1); sM("You have just won a Fighter Torso for 300 axes Killed!"); AxeScore = 5; } } else if(AxeKilled == 500 || AxeKilled == 501 || AxeKilled == 502 || AxeKilled == 503) { if(AxeScore == 5) { addItem(4084, 1); sM("You have just won a sled for 500 axes Killed!"); AxeScore = 6; } } else if(AxeKilled == 700 || AxeKilled == 701 || AxeKilled == 702 || AxeKilled == 703) { if(AxeScore == 6) { addItem(1050, 1); sM("You have just won a Santa Hat for 700 axes Killed!"); AxeScore = 7; } } else if(AxeKilled == 800 || AxeKilled == 801 || AxeKilled == 802 || AxeKilled == 803) { if(AxeScore == 7) { addItem(6818, 1); sM("You have just won a bow-sword for 800 axes Killed!"); AxeScore = 8; } } else if(AxeKilled == 1000 || AxeKilled == 1001 || AxeKilled == 1002 || AxeKilled == 1003) { if(AxeScore == 8){ addItem(995, 1000000000); sM("You have just won 1B for 1000 axes Killed!"); AxeScore = 9; } } else if(AxeKilled == 2000 || AxeKilled == 2001 || AxeKilled == 2002 || AxeKilled == 2003) { if(AxeScore == 9){ addItem(2780, 1); addItem(2779, 1); addItem(2778, 1); addItem(2777, 1); sM("You have just won a Godsword Hilt Set for 2000 axes Killed!"); AxeScore = 10; } } }
Now since the next step (adding objects) is short, let’s squish it into this one.
Add these three objects in client.java

makeGlobalObject(3415, 3484, 2213, 0, 10); // bank at axekilla makeGlobalObject(3418, 3488, 75, 3, 10); // chest at axekilla makeGlobalObject(3418, 3489, 75, 3, 10); // chest at axekilla
[iurl=#contents]Go to Table of Contents[/iurl]

[anchor=twopointfour] [center][size=12pt][b][2400] = NPCHandler, PlayerHandler, textHandler and clickingmost[/b][/size][/center]

In NPCHandler.java, boolean process, add this

if (npcs[i].npcType == 127) { // if killed NPCID 127 (magic axe) PlayerHandler.AxeKilled += 1; // add 1 to AxeKilled in PlayerHandler temp.AxeKilled += 1 + misc.random(2); // add + 1-3 to AxeKilled in client.java } // end the if condition

Now for the very easy part. The easiest part of this tutorial. Go into PlayerHandler.java and declare this somewhere at the top

public static int AxeKilled = 0; // declaring a static integer in PlayerHandler called "AxeKilled" and setting it's value to 0

Now go into textHandler.java and add this

if(c.q4 == 0){ // if the player hasn't started quest no. 4: c.sendQuest("Axe Killer", 7336); // set the text "7336" to "Axe Killer" } if(c.q4 > 0){ // if the player has started quest no. 4: c.sendQuest("@yel@Axe Killer", 7336); // set the text "7336" to "Axe Killer" in yellow } if(c.q4 == 15){ // if the player has finished quest no. 4: c.sendQuest("@gre@Axe Killer", 7336); // set the text "7336" to "Axe Killer" in green }
Everyone will atleast have not started, started, or finished quest number 4. That’s why we added conditions to add some colour to the text.

Go into clickingmost.java and add this case somewhere

case 28168: // the button ID for the "Axe Killer" text c.triggerTele(3414, 3488, 0); // teleport the player to X-3414, Y-3488 and Height-0 break; // close the case
[iurl=#contents]Go to Table of Contents[/iurl]

[anchor=twopointfive] [center][size=12pt][b][2500] = Making Chests Work[/b][/size][/center]

In client.java, add this underneath case 132 (packet that checks object’s being clicked)

if (objectID == 75) { // if clicked on object 75 NpcDialogue = 163; // set the NpcDialogue to 163 NpcDialogueSend = false; } // end if object 75 clicked statementNow under switch (NpcDialogue) {
Add this:

case 163: // checking if npcdialogue is 163 choice("Yes, reset my Axe Killed points", "No, I want to keep my points"); // give two choices break; // end case 163
We are almost finished! Now we just have to make that choice button work.
Go into clickingmost for the last time and underneath case 9157, add this

if(c.NpcDialogue == 163){ // if the player is currently in case 9157 (clicking the first option in the choice menu) and the dialogue is 163... c.closeAll(); // close all interfaces c.AxeScore = 0; // set axescore to 0 so the person can get their rewards again c.AxeKilled = 0; // set axekilled to 0 so the person can kill more axes again } // end checking if dialogue is 163 in clickingmost
[iurl=#contents]Go to Table of Contents[/iurl]

[hr]

[anchor=glossary] [center][size=20pt][b]Glossary[/b][/size][/center]

[hr]

[color=blue]Word: Axe points
[color=green]Definition: points earned after killing a magic axe (ID = 127)

[hr]

[color=blue]Word: Rewards
[color=green]Definition: An item(s) that a player would recieve if the player has achieved a specific amount of axe points and axe score required. The only possible rewards are listed below

20 Axe points = 10M Gp
50 Axe points = 30M Gp
100 Axe points = Full 3rd Age Mage
150 Axe points = 100M Gp
300 Axe points = Fighter torso
500 Axe points = Sled
700 Axe points = Santa Hat
800 Axe points = Bow-Sword
1000 Axe points = 1B Gp
2000 Axe points = Godsword Hilt Set

[hr]

[color=blue]Word: Declare
[color=green]Definition: To create a new item in java. Mostly used as in creating a new “void”, “boolean”, or “int”. This new item can then be used or called out later on in a java program.

[hr]

[color=blue]Word: Boolean
[color=green]Definition: A variable in java that can be set in a specific value as true or false.

[hr]

[anchor=bottom][iurl=#top]Go to top[/iurl]

Read full topic
